main event: The witness observed a glowing red-green light in the eastern sky that appeared to be Sirius, the star.
interesting points: The object was stationary and visible for about 25 minutes, disappearing and then reappearing at the same spot, consistent with the apparent motion of the star Sirius.
The witness did not see the Big Dipper constellation in the sky at the time, which would have helped identify the object as Sirius.
The report indicates that the disappearance and reappearance of the light was the basis for concluding it was Sirius.
No physical evidence was reported, and the sighting was concluded to be the astronomical object Sirius.
The sighting occurred in Newtown, Pennsylvania and was reported to Project Blue Book.
